definition: armband (e.g. as part of uniform or to show status)

sentences.english: All the soldiers must pin their armbands on.
sentences.chinese: 所有的戰士都必須佩戴袖章。

sentences.english: He carried the weapons and the metal armbands the green warriors wear.
sentences.chinese: 他帶來了武器和綠色武士們戴的金屬袖章。

sentences.english: He gave me the large metal band that had been around his arm.
sentences.chinese: 他給我那個曾經套在他胳膊上的巨大的金屬袖章。

sentences.english: The next day I went to school and I wore the armband all morning.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，我去上學，整個上午都戴着袖章。

sentences.english: Any student who wore an armband would be suspended from school.
sentences.chinese: 任何戴袖章的學生都會被停學。

sentences.english: and we decided to wear these black armbands to school.
sentences.chinese: 我們決定戴黑袖章上學。

sentences.english: V-shaped sleeve badge indicating military rank and service.
sentences.chinese: 表示軍階和服役的v形袖章。

sentences.english: So then we just planned this little thing of wearing these armbands to school.
sentences.chinese: 所以，那時候我們就計劃了戴袖章上學這件小事。

definition: ribbon (as a decoration)/cordon (diagonal belt worn as a sign of office or honor)
red neckscarf/by extension, a member of the Young Pioneers
red waistcoat/floor trader in stock market/stockbroker
buttoned mandarin jacket of the Qing dynasty 清代[Qing1 dai4] (1644-1911)
